docs.snippet: Diego Maradona blasted FIFA's ban on Uruguay striker Luis Suarez as "criminal" and said world soccer's governing body might as well handcuff the striker and lock him up in Guantanamo prison.
docs.lead_paragraph: Diego Maradona blasted FIFA's ban on Uruguay striker Luis Suarez as "criminal" and said world soccer's governing body might as well handcuff the striker and lock him up in Guantanamo prison.

headline.main: FIFA May as Well Throw Suarez Into Guantanamo: Maradona
headline.print_headline: FIFA May as Well Throw Suarez Into Guantanamo: Maradona

docs.snippet: Luis Suarez quietly returned home to Uruguay on Friday following his expulsion from the World Cup, long after a crowd that had come to greet him as a national hero had drifted away.
docs.lead_paragraph: Luis Suarez quietly returned home to Uruguay on Friday following his expulsion from the World Cup, long after a crowd that had come to greet him as a national hero had drifted away.

headline.main: Banned Suarez Back Home; Misses Crowd in Uruguay
headline.print_headline: Banned Suarez Back Home; Misses Crowd in Uruguay

docs.snippet: The international players' union has questioned the severity and focus of FIFA's punishment of Luis Suarez for biting an opponent at the World Cup, saying it "infringes his right to work" and doesn't offer him the treatment he needs.
docs.lead_paragraph: The international players' union has questioned the severity and focus of FIFA's punishment of Luis Suarez for biting an opponent at the World Cup, saying it "infringes his right to work" and doesn't offer him the treatment he needs.

headline.main: FIFPro Questions FIFA's Punishment of Luis Suarez
headline.print_headline: FIFPro Questions FIFA's Punishment of Luis Suarez

docs.snippet: This World Cup just got a whole lot easier for Costa Rica. According to the rankings, anyway.
docs.lead_paragraph: This World Cup just got a whole lot easier for Costa Rica. According to the rankings, anyway.

headline.main: World Cup Quarters for Costa Rica or Greece
headline.print_headline: World Cup Quarters for Costa Rica or Greece

docs.snippet: Uruguay striker Luis Suarez, who has been kicked out of the World Cup for biting an opponent, needs treatment to overcome his disciplinary problems, FIFA Secretary General Jerome Valcke said on Friday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay striker Luis Suarez, who has been kicked out of the World Cup for biting an opponent, needs treatment to overcome his disciplinary problems, FIFA Secretary General Jerome Valcke said on Friday.

headline.main: FIFA's Valcke Says Suarez Needs Treatment
headline.print_headline: FIFA's Valcke Says Suarez Needs Treatment

docs.snippet: Adidas might be attracting bad online buzz for its sponsorship of biting Uruguayan footballer Luis Suarez - but in the tussle to win the most World Cup social media play, the German firm says it is winning plenty of positive attention too.
docs.lead_paragraph: Adidas might be attracting bad online buzz for its sponsorship of biting Uruguayan footballer Luis Suarez - but in the tussle to win the most World Cup social media play, the German firm says it is winning plenty of positive attention too.

headline.main: Adidas and Nike Battle for Social Media World Cup
headline.print_headline: Adidas and Nike Battle for Social Media World Cup

docs.snippet: Emotion played a part in FIFA's decision to hand out a four-month ban to Uruguay striker Luis Suarez for biting Giorgio Chiellini at the World Cup, with a period of reflection needed, World Players' Union FIFPro said.
docs.lead_paragraph: Emotion played a part in FIFA's decision to hand out a four-month ban to Uruguay striker Luis Suarez for biting Giorgio Chiellini at the World Cup, with a period of reflection needed, World Players' Union FIFPro said.

headline.main: Too Much Emotion in Suarez Verdict, Say FIFPro
headline.print_headline: Too Much Emotion in Suarez Verdict, Say FIFPro

docs.snippet: Joedir Sancho Belmonte had a ticket to attend the famous final game of the 1950 World Cup between Brazil and Uruguay, but didn't get to use it because he stayed home with his sick mother.
docs.lead_paragraph: Joedir Sancho Belmonte had a ticket to attend the famous final game of the 1950 World Cup between Brazil and Uruguay, but didn't get to use it because he stayed home with his sick mother.

headline.main: Brazilian Trades in 1950 Ticket for 2014 Final
headline.print_headline: Brazilian Trades in 1950 Ticket for 2014 Final

docs.snippet: The players' union and football's governing body agree on one thing in the wake of the heavy ban imposed on Luis Suarez for his third biting incident: the Uruguay and Liverpool striker needs help.
docs.lead_paragraph: The players' union and football's governing body agree on one thing in the wake of the heavy ban imposed on Luis Suarez for his third biting incident: the Uruguay and Liverpool striker needs help.

headline.main: FIFA, Players' Union Agree Suarez Needs Treatment
headline.print_headline: FIFA, Players' Union Agree Suarez Needs Treatment

docs.snippet: Imagine having World Cup standouts Lionel Messi, Neymar, James Rodriguez and Arjen Robben all in the same team.
